text:
The 1934 FIFA World Cup Final was the second edition of the football tournament determine the 1934 FIFA World Cup champions: Italy and Czechoslovakia. It was played on 10 June 1934 at the Stadio Nazionale PNF in Rome, Italy.
The last surviving player from that final was Czechoslovakia goalkeeper František Plánička who died on 20 July 1996 at the age of 92.
